description: The `synthetic.leads` table represents potential business opportunities or prospective clients, indicated by individuals or companies, that are tracked by a company for future engagement. It captures detailed information about each lead, including personal contact information, organizational details, source, status, and conversion metrics, with the `lead_id` serving as the primary identifier. While it has foreign keys linking to unidentified tables, the table itself functions as a central repository for lead management, facilitating tracking and conversion processes, evident from fields like `converted_account_id` and `converted_contact_id`.

columns.name: lead_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each lead within the table, ensuring each entry has a distinct identifier. It serves as the primary key for differentiating individual leads.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: This column represents the given names of individuals that are being tracked or managed within the system. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: This column likely records the family name of individuals or entities associated with sales leads. The values suggest a diverse range of common last names.

columns.name: company
columns.description: This column likely contains the names of companies or organizations associated with leads, possibly indicating the entity that the lead is connected to or represents. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: title
columns.description: This column likely represents brief descriptions or summaries related to leads, capturing various aspects or statuses relevant to them. Purpose unclear from available data due to the abstract nature of the examples.

columns.name: email
columns.description: This column represents the email addresses of individuals who are potential customers or leads. The addresses appear to follow typical email formatting, indicating personal or generic contact methods.

columns.name: phone
columns.description: This column contains phone numbers in various formats, including international and extensions. These numbers likely serve as contact details for leads or potential clients.

columns.name: website
columns.description: This column represents the web addresses for various businesses or organizations associated with the leads in the dataset. The URLs appear to be personalized for each lead, suggesting an online presence for engagement or informational purposes.

columns.name: lead_source
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. Sample values suggest diverse and abstract content, making it difficult to determine specific business meaning.

columns.name: lead_status
columns.description: This column represents the current stage or outcome of a lead's progress through a given process. Sample values suggest stages include states such as "new," "pending," and "completed," indicating development or completion status.

columns.name: rating
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: industry
columns.description: This column appears to capture brief descriptions or phrases related to various industries or business activities. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: annual_revenue
columns.description: This column represents the estimated yearly revenue expressed in a numerical value, likely indicating the financial strength of potential business leads. The purpose of these specific amounts is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: employees
columns.description: This column likely indicates the number of employees associated with each lead entry in the dataset, reflecting the scale or size of the potential clients or businesses. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: description
columns.description: This column captures brief narrative entries or comments that provide context or insights regarding various aspects of leads, such as development, management, decisions, or actions taken, as reflected in the diverse and abstract sample sentences. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: address
columns.description: This column contains mailing address information associated with leads, including various formats such as military and diplomatic post office addresses. The data includes street addresses, city, state abbreviations, and postal codes, reflecting diverse geographical locations.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: This column likely represents a unique identifier for individuals or entities responsible for managing or owning the leads, allowing for tracking or assignment purposes. The exact purpose is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: converted_account_id
columns.description: This column likely represents the identifier for an account that a lead has been converted into within a business context. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: converted_contact_id
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: converted_date
columns.description: This column likely records the date when a lead was successfully converted to a customer or a different status. Purpose beyond this interpretation is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a lead record was initially created in the system. It defaults to the current timestamp upon the creation of a new lead, but its precise purpose is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a lead's information was last modified. It helps track the most recent updates or changes made to lead entries, with updates defaulting to the current timestamp if not specified.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX leads_pkey ON synthetic.leads USING btree (lead_id)
